review_title: Good place to grow career and serve community
pros:
Work environment--good and supportive supervisors, managers and coworkers
Population to work with--very rewarding
Work experience--opportunities to work with diverse population in terms of age, ethnicity, etc. and to work in different programs (school, outpatient, FSP, etc.)
cons:
DMH paperwork requirement
Conservative salary
High level of productivity (70%) requirement
Demanding workload

job_title: Psychiatric Social Worker in Cerritos, CA
pros: I think APCTC is a good entry for ASW. - Suportive and warm environment - Sufficient clinical supervison for licensure - Visa Sposor (H1B)
cons: - Low salary - Lack of training opportunities

job_title: Psychiatric Social Worker in Los Angeles, CA
pros: It’s great for experience. Management is helpful and supportive and they try to the best of their abilities. Everyone is welcoming and honest. They have a parking garage and walking distance to Starbucks.
cons: It’s very lackluster and not much feedback from supervisors. There is no work culture and no interactions from coworkers. It’s most a ghost town. Lastly, primary focus is meeting productivity than the integrity of your work.

job_title: Psychiatric Social Worker in Alhambra, CA
pros: Great supervisor support and team dynamic. Good benefits.
cons: HQ/HR staff difficult to get a hold of.

job_title: Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist (LMFT) in Alhambra, CA
pros: Very nice and friendly staff. Strong peer support. Employer 403B match is 7% after passing the probational period (6 months). Parts coverage for medical and dental. PTO and SL. Paid maternity leave.
cons: Productivity driven. Very little to no growth opportunities, career-wise and profession-wise. Not much clinical training. Outdated communication system. No current system to provide feedback. High turnover rate over the years.

job_title: Associate Marriage and Family Therapist in Pasadena, CA
pros: Very friendly working environment. Supportive teamwork.
cons: Lack of holistic structure, unclear management, and leadership.

pros: The patients are easy to work with and willing to work in therapy sessions. Mileage reimbursement and usage of company car. Provision of office, business cards, and clients.
cons: High turnover, poor management/administration, deceitful work environment and no respect for employees. This company makes me lose  hope in humanity because they simply "DO NOT CARE." Patients are just 'quotas' to meet for their funding. Have no interest in patients' well-being or regarding treatment or the progress of it. Wants to keep patients sick so they always come back. Every employee there is "disposable." Practices are unethical.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Los Angeles, CA
pros: sometimes the bosses treat you out and there is mileage reimbursement but then again the rate went down from .57 to .54
cons:
cheap in pay some of my staff get paid minimum wage even though its the same position and they were before me

horrible communication to the clients and among the staff
getting a raise here is difficult
they don't pay for your parking if your part time
the monthly production rate is 70% which is so lame

part time employees working under 20 hours get no vacation, which is crud since I just found out a year after working with this company, told supervisor to find out what's going on and he never responded back 

company is so cheap that they keep using bad quality gps, the gps falls off the windshield and also forever to get a signal sometimes it doesn't get a signal at all 

they also request useless stuff like car insurance and driver license when you don't drive clients and your not able to drive clients if your part time based on the position

one of the office is bad quality looking on the outside and inside

its so sad that staff don't even talk about their rates since they know its so low 
the billing system, cliniktrak is so poorly made and needs to autosave and one of the options need to be hidden on the form until the other selections have to be done, sometimes i select something on the form and it says that another part of the form has to be filled out first

job_title: Psychiatric Social Worker I in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Flexible working hours (make your own appointment schedule), friendly staff team, wide array of experiences working with diverse clinical/case management needs
cons: Pay on lower side in ratio to workload, at times ambiguous management support, little room for career/pay growth (but it's non-profit, so that may be expected)

pros: Serving overlooked ethnic community, training opportunities (depends on your manager), gain your license hours fast, diverse population to work with. Sick/Vacation Paid, caring co-workers... Room to grow (somewhat)
cons: Pay can be better... also health benefits... management team-- a lot of emphasize on billing and productivity.

review_title: Good training for newly registered therapists
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Good experience; trainings in EBPs; field-based and on-call incentives, language compensation. Great opportunity for newly registered interns. Manageable caseload. Good medical, dental, vision benefits.
cons: DMH paperwork, high turnover, management. Work can be draining.

job_title: Marriage and Family Therapist Registered Intern in Glendale, CA
pros: Supportive, kind people who have great clinical skills.
